values.description:
The worlds_installed and gz_log tests have been failing consistently on the default branch for a while (see [jenkins test summary](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/741/testReport/)). It appears that each test was using the deprecated names of command-line tools (gzsdf and gzlog) instead of the gz tool. This pull request fixes the tests and adds some debugging console output for the worlds_installed test.

* ubuntu precise jenkins [build 1](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/64) and [build 2](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/65), no repeated test failures
* [homebrew jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew_bcn-amd64/101/), no unexpected test failures
values.title: Fix worlds_installed and gz_log tests

summary.html:
The worlds_installed and gz_log tests have been failing consistently on the default branch for a while (see jenkins test summary). It appears that each test was using the deprecated names of command-line tools (gzsdf and gzlog) instead of the gz tool. This pull request fixes the tests and adds some debugging console output for the worlds_installed test.

  • ubuntu precise jenkins build 1 and build 2, no repeated test failures
  • homebrew jenkins build, no unexpected test failures

values.description:
Usage:

Select a model -> Press Ctrl+C or Click on Copy Icon -> Press Ctrl+V or Click on Paste Icon -> Click anywhere on ground plane to spawn the model.

Changes

- added function to save visual geom sdf info in Link

- added new icons

- added an integration test

values.description: The WorldPlugin::Init method was being called twice in World.cc, first in World::LoadPlugin, then later in a loop in World::LoadPlugins (#1208). This eliminates the Init call from World::LoadPlugin.
values.title: Remove redundant call of WorldPlugin::Init from gazebo_2.2 branch (#1208)

summary.raw: The WorldPlugin::Init method was being called twice in World.cc, first in World::LoadPlugin, then later in a loop in World::LoadPlugins (#1208). This eliminates the Init call from World::LoadPlugin.
summary.html: The WorldPlugin::Init method was being called twice in World.cc, first in World::LoadPlugin, then later in a loop in World::LoadPlugins (#1208). This eliminates the Init call from World::LoadPlugin.

values.title: Don't compile hydra plugins on apple (#1210)

summary.html:
HydraPlugin.cc includes several linux headers:

#include <libusb-1.0/libusb.h>
#include <linux/hidraw.h>
#include <linux/input.h>
#include <linux/types.h>

So don't compile on mac for now.

values.description:
This PR removes some unnecessary headers included in a bunch of gazebo plugins.

This unnecessary includes introduced a dependency on `libavformat`, `libavcoded` and `libswscale` in the compilation of third party plugins inherited by "upstream" gazebo plugins.

In particular we experienced this issue with a plugin inherited from the `CameraPlugin` (related failed Travis build: https://travis-ci.org/robotology/gazebo_yarp_plugins/builds/27417360 ).
values.title: Remove unnecessary inclusion of gazebo.hh and common.hh headers in plugins

summary.raw:
This PR removes some unnecessary headers included in a bunch of gazebo plugins.

This unnecessary includes introduced a dependency on `libavformat`, `libavcoded` and `libswscale` in the compilation of third party plugins inherited by "upstream" gazebo plugins.

In particular we experienced this issue with a plugin inherited from the `CameraPlugin` (related failed Travis build: https://travis-ci.org/robotology/gazebo_yarp_plugins/builds/27417360 ).
summary.html:
This PR removes some unnecessary headers included in a bunch of gazebo plugins.

This unnecessary includes introduced a dependency on libavformat, libavcoded and libswscale in the compilation of third party plugins inherited by "upstream" gazebo plugins.

In particular we experienced this issue with a plugin inherited from the CameraPlugin (related failed Travis build: https://travis-ci.org/robotology/gazebo_yarp_plugins/builds/27417360 ).

values.title: Merged default into this branch.

values.description:
[DART 4.0 has been released](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/releases/tag/v4.0). It improves support for universal and screw joints (partial fixes to #1096, #1011), joint springs (partial fix for #975) and complete fixes for #910, #1079, #1174.

DART 4.0 has a lot of API changes, so merging this pull request will make DART 4.0 the minimum required version. There is a minor ABI breakage in DARTLink.hh, but I have targeted this to the gazebo_3.1 branch since we have not yet released any debian packages that link against dart. If people think this is a bad idea, I will re-target to default.

To test, you can build dart from source (use [v4.0 tag](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/releases/tag/v4.0) or [release-4.0 branch](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/tree/release-4.0)) or install libdart-core4-dev from the dartsim ppa (also requires libccd and fcl):
~~~
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:libccd-debs
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:fcl-debs
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:dartsim
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install libdart-core4-dev
~~~

I still need to update the homebrew formula.

UPDATE: it is now required to build dart from the [release-4.0 branch](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/tree/release-4.0), as there are some fixes there that haven't been tagged and released yet.
values.title: DART 4.0 support

summary.raw:
[DART 4.0 has been released](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/releases/tag/v4.0). It improves support for universal and screw joints (partial fixes to #1096, #1011), joint springs (partial fix for #975) and complete fixes for #910, #1079, #1174.

DART 4.0 has a lot of API changes, so merging this pull request will make DART 4.0 the minimum required version. There is a minor ABI breakage in DARTLink.hh, but I have targeted this to the gazebo_3.1 branch since we have not yet released any debian packages that link against dart. If people think this is a bad idea, I will re-target to default.

To test, you can build dart from source (use [v4.0 tag](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/releases/tag/v4.0) or [release-4.0 branch](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/tree/release-4.0)) or install libdart-core4-dev from the dartsim ppa (also requires libccd and fcl):
~~~
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:libccd-debs
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:fcl-debs
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:dartsim
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install libdart-core4-dev
~~~

I still need to update the homebrew formula.

UPDATE: it is now required to build dart from the [release-4.0 branch](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/tree/release-4.0), as there are some fixes there that haven't been tagged and released yet.
summary.html:
DART 4.0 has been released. It improves support for universal and screw joints (partial fixes to #1096, #1011), joint springs (partial fix for #975) and complete fixes for #910, #1079, #1174.

DART 4.0 has a lot of API changes, so merging this pull request will make DART 4.0 the minimum required version. There is a minor ABI breakage in DARTLink.hh, but I have targeted this to the gazebo_3.1 branch since we have not yet released any debian packages that link against dart. If people think this is a bad idea, I will re-target to default.

To test, you can build dart from source (use v4.0 tag or release-4.0 branch) or install libdart-core4-dev from the dartsim ppa (also requires libccd and fcl):

sudo apt-add-repository ppa:libccd-debs
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:fcl-debs
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:dartsim
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install libdart-core4-dev

I still need to update the homebrew formula.

UPDATE: it is now required to build dart from the release-4.0 branch, as there are some fixes there that haven't been tagged and released yet.

values.description: This is a refactoring of pull request #1052 (fixing inertia ratio reduction for ODE in gazebo 1.9) with an additional test based on a double pendulum with large inertia ratio. It modifies around 300 lines of quickstep.cpp (much of it moving debugging printf's around), as compared to over 800 lines of code in pull request #1052.
values.title: Refactored inertia ratio reduction (pull request #1052)

summary.raw: This is a refactoring of pull request #1052 (fixing inertia ratio reduction for ODE in gazebo 1.9) with an additional test based on a double pendulum with large inertia ratio. It modifies around 300 lines of quickstep.cpp (much of it moving debugging printf's around), as compared to over 800 lines of code in pull request #1052.
summary.html: This is a refactoring of pull request #1052 (fixing inertia ratio reduction for ODE in gazebo 1.9) with an additional test based on a double pendulum with large inertia ratio. It modifies around 300 lines of quickstep.cpp (much of it moving debugging printf's around), as compared to over 800 lines of code in pull request #1052.

values.description:
After pull request #1110 was merged to gazebo_3.1, I merged it forward to default in 6b194bd. It was a little tricky because there were conflicts, and it ended up [breaking the test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/36/testReport/junit/(root)/WorldTest/ModifyLight/). I thought I could be cute and fix the test with a quick commit to default (93fe281), but the test is [still broken](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/37/testReport/junit/(root)/WorldTest/ModifyLight/). This pull request fixes it.

The problem arose when merging modifications to the world.cc test from two different branches. On default, there was a sub-test for removing a light, which I merged to occur before the other test, so we need to update the number of expected lights.
values.title: Fix INTEGRATION_world ModifyLight test

I thought I could be cute and fix the test with a quick commit to default (93fe281), but the test is [still broken](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/37/testReport/junit/(root)/WorldTest/ModifyLight/). This pull request fixes it.

summary.html:
After pull request #1110 was merged to gazebo_3.1, I merged it forward to default in 6b194bd. It was a little tricky because there were conflicts, and it ended up breaking the test. I thought I could be cute and fix the test with a quick commit to default (93fe281), but the test is still broken. This pull request fixes it.

The problem arose when merging modifications to the world.cc test from two different branches. On default, there was a sub-test for removing a light, which I merged to occur before the other test, so we need to update the number of expected lights.

values.description: New tags for joint spring stiffness and reference position are added in [sdformat pull request 102](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/102/add-spring_reference-and-spring_stiffness/diff). This pull request reads them and sets joint spring stiffness and reference position accordingly. It includes an addition to the existing joint spring test.

values.description:
Create a PhysicsFixture class to simplify some of the physics integration tests. Many of these tests immediately call `physics::get_world()` after `Load()` and then `world->GetPhysicsEngine()`. This puts those into a `LoadWorld()` call and results in about 200 fewer lines of code.

First stage of an effort to make it easier to create new tests.
values.title: Create PhysicsFixture for physics tests

summary.raw:
Create a PhysicsFixture class to simplify some of the physics integration tests. Many of these tests immediately call `physics::get_world()` after `Load()` and then `world->GetPhysicsEngine()`. This puts those into a `LoadWorld()` call and results in about 200 fewer lines of code.

First stage of an effort to make it easier to create new tests.
summary.html:
Create a PhysicsFixture class to simplify some of the physics integration tests. Many of these tests immediately call physics::get_world() after Load() and then world->GetPhysicsEngine(). This puts those into a LoadWorld() call and results in about 200 fewer lines of code.

First stage of an effort to make it easier to create new tests.

values.description:
This includes the modifications done for getting actor animation working. Please refer #!/osrf/gazebo/issue/538/gazebo-actor-sdf-13-parser-error for more details.

**Tested for:**
gazebo worlds/actor.world
turltebot simulator + RViz

**Known issues:**
If the actor skin file is set to sub_16.dae, walk.dae, stand.dae, talk_a.dae, talk_b.dae or run.dae, it renders the actor very weird. **Workaround** is to specify a working DAE (moonwalk.dae, sit_down.dae, sitting.dae and stand_up.dae) for <skin><filename> and load your desired animation DAE in <animation><filename>. It looks like the scale of the armature and mesh for not working DAEs are not same. Probably this may be an existing armature scaling issue.
values.title: Fix for actor animation not working

It looks like the scale of the armature and mesh for not working DAEs are not same. Probably this may be an existing armature scaling issue.

values.description:
* switched to using effort based velocity pid controller for the diff drive plugin
 * increase tolerance for simbody, for unknow reason pioneer2dx travels slower than ode
 * fix `GetCollision` to return bounding sphere based bounding box
 * switch pioneer2dx test to get wheel radius by typecasting into cylinder
values.title: fix issue #866

summary.raw:
* switched to using effort based velocity pid controller for the diff drive plugin
 * increase tolerance for simbody, for unknow reason pioneer2dx travels slower than ode
 * fix `GetCollision` to return bounding sphere based bounding box
 * switch pioneer2dx test to get wheel radius by typecasting into cylinder
summary.html:
• switched to using effort based velocity pid controller for the diff drive plugin
  • increase tolerance for simbody, for unknow reason pioneer2dx travels slower than ode
  • fix GetCollision to return bounding sphere based bounding box
  • switch pioneer2dx test to get wheel radius by typecasting into cylinder

values.description:
Debian requires all binaries to be documented using manpages. This is a minimal approach to gzmodel_create. Feel free to improve it.

**UPDATE:** @nkoenig proposed the complete removal of the script for gazebo_3.1 version.
values.title: Remove the gzmodel_create script

values.description: Skyx code is cleaning the cflags which prevents it to be affected by other flags defined outside and inside the gazebo code. Remove that. As a side effect, it is using his own header for visibility which was not complete for Linux.
values.title: Skyx code should respect compiler flags

summary.raw: Skyx code is cleaning the cflags which prevents it to be affected by other flags defined outside and inside the gazebo code. Remove that. As a side effect, it is using his own header for visibility which was not complete for Linux.

values.description:
DART 4.1 is now required for the default branch of gazebo. Also, the `Skeleton::getDof` function was [deprecated](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/209) in favor of `Skeleton::getNumDofs`. This fixes the deprecation warnings.

[Pending jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any_dart4-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/19)
values.title: Require DART 4.1 and fix deprecation warnings

summary.raw:
DART 4.1 is now required for the default branch of gazebo. Also, the `Skeleton::getDof` function was [deprecated](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/209) in favor of `Skeleton::getNumDofs`. This fixes the deprecation warnings.

[Pending jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any_dart4-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/19)
summary.html:
DART 4.1 is now required for the default branch of gazebo. Also, the Skeleton::getDof function was deprecated in favor of Skeleton::getNumDofs. This fixes the deprecation warnings.

Pending jenkins build

values.description: There is a [compiler warning](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/49/warnings16Result/) after merging pull request #1097. The function `Joint::SetAngle` was still being used in a plugin even though it had been deprecated. Also, I replaced a few instances of SetAngle in error messages with SetPosition and fixed a typo.
values.title: Fix SetAngle warning and replace SetAngle with SetPosition

summary.raw: There is a [compiler warning](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/49/warnings16Result/) after merging pull request #1097. The function `Joint::SetAngle` was still being used in a plugin even though it had been deprecated. Also, I replaced a few instances of SetAngle in error messages with SetPosition and fixed a typo.
summary.html: There is a compiler warning after merging pull request #1097. The function Joint::SetAngle was still being used in a plugin even though it had been deprecated. Also, I replaced a few instances of SetAngle in error messages with SetPosition and fixed a typo.

values.description:
Two new tools added to the gui

**Align**

1. in Arrow mode,  select a model with the mouse

2. Ctrl + Left Click to select more models (the last one selected will be used as the basis of alignment)

3. Click on the align icon and choose an align configuration

**Snap**

1. Click on the snap icon

2. Click on a face of a model to select a triangle on its mesh

3. Click on a face of another model to snap the first model to it.

Sorry for the long pull request

Fixes issue #1256
values.title: GUI Align and Snap tools

summary.raw:
Two new tools added to the gui

**Align**

1. in Arrow mode,  select a model with the mouse

2. Ctrl + Left Click to select more models (the last one selected will be used as the basis of alignment)

3. Click on the align icon and choose an align configuration

**Snap**

1. Click on the snap icon

2. Click on a face of a model to select a triangle on its mesh

3. Click on a face of another model to snap the first model to it.

Sorry for the long pull request

Fixes issue #1256
summary.html:
Two new tools added to the gui

Align

  1. in Arrow mode, select a model with the mouse

  2. Ctrl + Left Click to select more models (the last one selected will be used as the basis of alignment)

  3. Click on the align icon and choose an align configuration

Snap

  1. Click on the snap icon

  2. Click on a face of a model to select a triangle on its mesh

  3. Click on a face of another model to snap the first model to it.

Sorry for the long pull request

Fixes issue #1256

values.description:
Require sdformat 2.0.1 for gazebo 3.1 and up (due to pull request #1117). Also update gz_TEST based on the new sdf description. Use the sdformat prerelease to test:
~~~
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install libsdformat2-dev-prerelease:
~~~

This will probably [fail in Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/84/) since it is not using the sdformat prerelease.
values.title: Require sdformat_2.0.1 and update gz_TEST

summary.raw:
Require sdformat 2.0.1 for gazebo 3.1 and up (due to pull request #1117). Also update gz_TEST based on the new sdf description. Use the sdformat prerelease to test:
~~~
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install libsdformat2-dev-prerelease:
~~~

This will probably [fail in Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/84/) since it is not using the sdformat prerelease.
summary.html:
Require sdformat 2.0.1 for gazebo 3.1 and up (due to pull request #1117). Also update gz_TEST based on the new sdf description. Use the sdformat prerelease to test:

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install libsdformat2-dev-prerelease:

This will probably fail in Jenkins since it is not using the sdformat prerelease.
